Static Methods

public ArrayIndexOf(array : Array<Dynamic>, whatToFind : Dynamic, ?fromIndex : Int) : Int

public SetArrayLength(array : Array<Dynamic>, newLength : Int) : Void

public abs(Value : Float) : Float

Calculate the absolute value of a number.
Parameters:
Value - Any number.
Returns:
The absolute value of that number.

public bound(Value : Float, Min : Float, Max : Float) : Float

Bound a number by a minimum and maximum. Ensures that this number is no smaller than the minimum, and no larger than the maximum.
Parameters:
Value - Any number.
Min - Any number.
Max - Any number.
Returns:
The bounded value of the number.

public ceil(Value : Float) : Int

Round up to the next whole number. E.g. ceil(1.3) == 2, and ceil(-2.3) == -3.
Parameters:
Value - Any number.
Returns:
The rounded value of that number.

public compareClassNames(Object1 : Dynamic, Object2 : Dynamic) : Bool

Check to see if two objects have the same class name.
Parameters:
Object1 - The first object you want to check.
Object2 - The second object you want to check.
Returns:
Whether they have the same class name or not.

public computeVelocity(Velocity : Float, ?Acceleration : Float, ?Drag : Float, ?Max : Float) : Float

A tween-like function that takes a starting velocity and some other factors and returns an altered velocity.
Parameters:
Velocity - Any component of velocity (e.g. 20).
Acceleration - Rate at which the velocity is changing.
Drag - Really kind of a deceleration, this is how much the velocity changes if Acceleration is not set.
Max - An absolute value cap for the velocity.
Returns:
The altered Velocity value.

public floor(Value : Float) : Int

Round down to the next whole number. E.g. floor(1.7) == 1, and floor(-2.7) == -2.
Parameters:
Value - Any number.
Returns:
The rounded value of that number.

public formatArray(AnyArray : Array<Dynamic>) : String

Generate a comma-separated string from an array. Especially useful for tracing or other debug output.
Parameters:
AnyArray - Any Array object.
Returns:
A comma-separated String containing the .toString() output of each element in the array.

public formatMoney(Amount : Float, ?ShowDecimal : Bool, ?EnglishStyle : Bool) : String

Automatically commas and decimals in the right places for displaying money amounts. Does not include a dollar sign or anything, so doesn't really do much if you call say var results:String = FlxU.formatMoney(10,false); However, very handy for displaying large sums or decimal money values.
Parameters:
Amount - How much moneys (in dollars, or the equivalent "main" currency - i.e. not cents).
ShowDecimal - Whether to show the decimals/cents component. Default value is true.
EnglishStyle - Major quantities (thousands, millions, etc) separated by commas, and decimal by a period. Default value is true.
Returns:
A nicely formatted String. Does not include a dollar sign or anything!

public formatTicks(StartTicks : Int, EndTicks : Int) : String

Takes two "ticks" timestamps and formats them into the number of seconds that passed as a String. Useful for logging, debugging, the watch window, or whatever else.
Parameters:
StartTicks - The first timestamp from the system.
EndTicks - The second timestamp from the system.
Returns:
A String containing the formatted time elapsed information.

public formatTime(Seconds : Int, ?ShowMS : Bool) : String

Format seconds as minutes with a colon, an optionally with milliseconds too.
Parameters:
Seconds - The number of seconds (for example, time remaining, time spent, etc).
ShowMS - Whether to show milliseconds after a "." as well. Default value is false.
Returns:
A nicely formatted String, like "1:03".

public fromIntToUInt(number : Int) : Int

public getAngle(Point1 : FlxPoint, Point2 : FlxPoint) : Float

Calculates the angle between two points. 0 degrees points straight up.
Parameters:
Point1 - The X coordinate of the point.
Point2 - The Y coordinate of the point.
Returns:
The angle in degrees, between -180 and 180.

public getClass(Name : String) : Class<Dynamic>

Look up a Class object by its string name.
Parameters:
Name - The String name of the Class you are interested in.
Returns:
A Class object.

public getClassName(Obj : Dynamic, ?Simple : Bool) : String

Get the String name of any Object.
Parameters:
Obj - The Object object in question.
Simple - Returns only the class name, not the package or packages.
Returns:
The name of the Class as a String object.

public getDistance(Point1 : FlxPoint, Point2 : FlxPoint) : Float

Calculate the distance between two points.
Parameters:
Point1 - A FlxPoint object referring to the first location.
Point2 - A FlxPoint object referring to the second location.
Returns:
The distance between the two points as a floating point Number object.

public getHSB(Color : UInt, ?Results : Array<Float>) : Array<Float>

Loads an array with the HSB values of a Flash uint color. Hue is a value between 0 and 360. Saturation, Brightness and Alpha are as floating point numbers between 0 and 1.
Parameters:
Color - The color you want to break into components.
Results - An optional parameter, allows you to use an array that already exists in memory to store the result.
Returns:
An Array object containing the Red, Green, Blue and Alpha values of the given color.

public getRGBA(Color : UInt, ?Results : Array<Float>) : Array<Float>

Loads an array with the RGBA values of a Flash uint color. RGB values are stored 0-255. Alpha is stored as a floating point number between 0 and 1.
Parameters:
Color - The color you want to break into components.
Results - An optional parameter, allows you to use an array that already exists in memory to store the result.
Returns:
An Array object containing the Red, Green, Blue and Alpha values of the given color.

public getRandom(Objects : Array<Dynamic>, ?StartIndex : Int, ?Length : Int) : Dynamic

Fetch a random entry from the given array. Will return null if random selection is missing, or array has no entries. FlxG.getRandom() is deterministic and safe for use with replays/recordings. HOWEVER, FlxU.getRandom() is NOT deterministic and unsafe for use with replays/recordings.
Parameters:
Objects - A Flash array of objects.
StartIndex - Optional offset off the front of the array. Default value is 0, or the beginning of the array.
Length - Optional restriction on the number of values you want to randomly select from.
Returns:
The random object that was selected.

public getTicks() : Int

Just grabs the current "ticks" or time in milliseconds that has passed since Flash Player started up. Useful for finding out how long it takes to execute specific blocks of code.
Returns:
A uint to be passed to FlxU.endProfile().

public makeColor(Red : UInt, Green : UInt, Blue : UInt, ?Alpha : Float) : UInt

Generate a Flash uint color from RGBA components.
Parameters:
Red - The red component, between 0 and 255.
Green - The green component, between 0 and 255.
Blue - The blue component, between 0 and 255.
Alpha - How opaque the color should be, either between 0 and 1 or 0 and 255.
Returns:
The color as a uint.

public makeColorFromHSB(Hue : Float, Saturation : Float, Brightness : Float, ?Alpha : Float) : UInt

Generate a Flash uint color from HSB components.
Parameters:
Hue - A number between 0 and 360, indicating position on a color strip or wheel.
Saturation - A number between 0 and 1, indicating how colorful or gray the color should be. 0 is gray, 1 is vibrant.
Brightness - A number between 0 and 1, indicating how bright the color should be. 0 is black, 1 is full bright.
Alpha - How opaque the color should be, either between 0 and 1 or 0 and 255.
Returns:
The color as a uint.

public max(Number1 : Float, Number2 : Float) : Float

Figure out which number is larger.
Parameters:
Number1 - Any number.
Number2 - Any number.
Returns:
The larger of the two numbers.

public min(Number1 : Float, Number2 : Float) : Float

Figure out which number is smaller.
Parameters:
Number1 - Any number.
Number2 - Any number.
Returns:
The smaller of the two numbers.

public openURL(URL : String) : Void

Opens a web page in a new tab or window.
Parameters:
URL - The address of the web page.

public rotatePoint(X : Float, Y : Float, PivotX : Float, PivotY : Float, Angle : Float, ?point : FlxPoint) : FlxPoint

Rotates a point in 2D space around another point by the given angle.
Parameters:
X - The X coordinate of the point you want to rotate.
Y - The Y coordinate of the point you want to rotate.
PivotX - The X coordinate of the point you want to rotate around.
PivotY - The Y coordinate of the point you want to rotate around.
Angle - Rotate the point by this many degrees.
Point - Optional FlxPoint to store the results in.
Returns:
A FlxPoint containing the coordinates of the rotated point.

public round(Value : Float) : Int

Round to the closest whole number. E.g. round(1.7) == 2, and round(-2.3) == -2.
Parameters:
Value - Any number.
Returns:
The rounded value of that number.

public shuffle(Objects : Array<Dynamic>, HowManyTimes : Int) : Array<Dynamic>

Shuffles the entries in an array into a new random order. FlxG.shuffle() is deterministic and safe for use with replays/recordings. HOWEVER, FlxU.shuffle() is NOT deterministic and unsafe for use with replays/recordings.
Parameters:
A - A Flash Array object containing...stuff.
HowManyTimes - How many swaps to perform during the shuffle operation. Good rule of thumb is 2-4 times as many objects are in the list.
Returns:
The same Flash Array object that you passed in in the first place.

public srand(Seed : Float) : Float

Generates a random number based on the seed provided.
Parameters:
Seed - A number between 0 and 1, used to generate a predictable random number (very optional).
Returns:
A Number between 0 and 1.

public new()
